quiz.question: What does the user-centered design framework focus on?
options: User-centered design involves taking an idea and creating a working product using the steps strategy, scope, structure, skeleton, and surface.
User-centered design puts the focus on the user. In order to do so, UX designers must understand, specify, design and evaluate during the design process.
User-centered design involves doing something again by building on previous versions and making adjustments.
User-centered design involves deep-diving into a particular role like interaction, visual, or motion design.

quiz.question: Identify the five elements of UX design framework. Select all that apply.
options: Strategy
Scope
Surface
Skeleton
Specify
Structure

quiz.question: As a UX designer, your goal is to focus on the end user.
options: True
False

quiz.question: Fill in the blank: In the user-centered design framework, you need to first understand how the user experience the product or similar products in order to ______.
